qas.question: What served as the capital of France in spirit during the Occupation?
What meeting brought about changes in France's policy towards its colonies?
When did Brazzaville get its own local government?
What did the 1946 constitution establish Brazzaville as?
What served as the symbolic capital of France during World War I?
When was Brazzaville established as the Third Republic?
What was the symbolic capital of the Nazis from 1940 to 1943?
What stopped Congo from benefiting from the postwar expansion of colonial administrative and infrastructure spending?
What kind of legislature did Brazzaville receive prior to 1946?

context: During the Nazi occupation of France during World War II, <a0_0><b4_0><b6_0>Brazzaville<b6_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/> functioned as the symbolic capital of Free France between 1940 and 1943. The <a1_0>Brazzaville Conference of 1944<a1_0/> heralded a period of major reform in French colonial policy. Congo benefited from the postwar expansion of colonial administrative and infrastructure spending as a result of its <b7_0>central geographic location<b7_0/> within AEF and the federal capital at Brazzaville. It also received a <b8_0>local<b8_0/> legislature after the adoption of the <a2_0><b5_0>1946<b5_0/><a2_0/> constitution that established <a3_0>the Fourth Republic<a3_0/>.
